contextId.information: Here anger is spoken of as if it were a person that could turn away from Israel. Its turning represents Yahweh's stopping be angry with Israel  AT: "Surely Yahweh has stopped being angry with me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: surely his anger has turned away from me

contextId.information: Jeremiah emphasizes Yahweh's judgment by saying that the earth itself expresses great sorrow. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: land will mourn, and the heavens above will darken

contextId.information: Yahweh describes Jerusalem as though she were a woman. AT: "daughter of Zion who is like a beautiful and delicate woman." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: The daughter of Zion, the beautiful and delicate woman

contextId.information: Yahweh says what the people of Judah will say when he destroys the land. The people of Judah will compare death to a person who can climb in windows to attack the people inside. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: For death has come through our windows

contextId.information: AT: "Yahweh's wrath will bring about all the punishment that he has planned" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: it has carried out and brought into being his heart's intentions

contextId.information: The voice and eyes are spoken of as if they were people whom Rachel needed to keep from moving. AT: "Stop weeping aloud and stop crying tears" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: Hold your voice back from weeping and your eyes from tears

contextId.information: The face is a metonym for the person's presence. AT: "from my presence" or "completely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Yahweh causing disaster on the people as he promised is spoken of as if his word would attack them. AT: "what I have said will happen and you will have a disaster." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: my words will certainly attack you with disaster

contextId.information: This refers to the sword of Yahweh as if it was a person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
The word "you" refers to the "sword of Yahweh." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: How can you be quiet, for Yahweh has commanded you

contextId.information: Here "he" refers to the entire nation of Moab. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: Moab has felt secure since he was young
